metadata.title: CVE-2015-3333 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google V8 before 4.2.77.14, as usedin Google Chrome before 42.0.2311.90, allow attackers to cause a denial ofservice or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3333` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu1.1179
chromium-browser-l10n - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu1.1179
chromium-chromedriver - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu1.1179
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu1.1179
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu1.1179
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu1.1179').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
